channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: American Twitch streamer 'Asmongold' banned for calling Palestinians 'terrible' and 'inferior' on live stream
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Phoenix police officers shout at and punch deaf man in bodycam footage, sparking criticism
item.description: In Phoenix, Arizona, bodycam footage shows police officers shouting orders at a deaf Black man, Tyron McAlpin, and using excessive force during his arrest. McAlpin's attorney claims his rights were violated, and public outcry has prompted an internal investigation and personal review by the Maricopa County attorney.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea revises Constitution, declares South Korea as 'hostile State'
item.description: North Korea has declared South Korea a 'hostile' state in its constitution, escalating tensions by destroying roads and railways. This follows Kim Jong Un's labeling of Seoul as the 'principal enemy' and amendments solidifying the rift. Accusations of anti-regime leaflet drops by drones further strain relations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Australian PM Anthony Albanese buys $4.3million beach pad amid housing crisis
item.description: Australian PM Anthony Albanese faces backlash after acquiring a multimillion-dollar waterfront property amid a housing crisis. Critics say the purchase shows detachment from struggling citizens. Albanese defends his choice, citing personal reasons and plans to sell his Sydney home. His government aims to address housing affordability as a critical issue before the upcoming elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US B-2 bombers launch precision strikes on Houthi weapons facilities in Yemen
item.description: The US military conducted precision airstrikes on underground Houthi weapons storage in Yemen, using B-2 bombers targeting sites linked to recent attacks on vessels. Defense Secretary Austin stated these underground facilities posed threats in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden. Initial assessments show no civilian casualties. Houthi media claimed additional strikes in Sanaa and Saada.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump, at Latino event, stands by false claims of immigrants eating pets
item.description: Republican candidate Donald Trump reiterated unverified claims about Haitian immigrants in Ohio eating pets, despite local officials refuting them. He addressed Latino voters, while proposing mass deportations and using harsh immigration rhetoric. Trump aims to curb Democratic support among Latino voters, especially in battleground states.

item.title: Mexico's ex-public security chief sentenced to 38-plus years in US for taking cartel bribes
item.description: Genaro Garcia Luna, former top security official of Mexico, was sentenced to over 38 years in a U.S. prison for taking bribes from the Sinaloa cartel. He was convicted of providing intelligence and safe passage to traffickers. Garcia Luna maintains his innocence, claiming the case relied on false information. His defense plans to appeal.

item.title: 'My bad': Woman tears down Greek flags, confusing them for Israel's
item.description: A TikTok video went viral featuring a woman mistakenly tearing down Greek flags outside a New Jersey restaurant, thinking they were Israeli flags. After being informed of her error, she apologized. The incident, reported to the police, occurred in March and sparked widespread ridicule online, highlighting gaps in education and awareness.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Turns out Trump was right': FBI 'quietly' updates crime data, reveals increase
item.description: During the September 10 presidential debate, Trump was fact-checked by ABC News moderator David Muir, who noted that the “FBI says overall violent crime is coming down in this country.” In 2021, the FBI moved to a new system of collecting crime data — the National Incident-Based Reporting System (NIBRS) and retired its Summary Reporting System (SRS).
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Meghan Markle lie about daughter Lilibet's name? Prince Harry too...
item.description: ​The old issue resurfaced as Meghan Markle is on the radar for her growing distance with Prince Harry and speculations are rife that the royal couple may head for a divorce. On professional front too, Meghan is seeing a bad press after her former staff said she is a dictator in high heels.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Quite bizarre': Kamala Harris reacts to Donald Trump's 'father of IVF' claim
item.description: “I’m going to say what I’ve said publicly and what I’ve said many times based on my observations. … Donald Trump is increasingly unstable, and as has been said by people who have worked closely with him even when he was president, he’s unfit to be president of the United States,” Kamala Harris said as she also questioned what Donald Trump meant by 'I am the father of IVF' comment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy replies if he supports Trump's 'enemy within' narrative: 'Had Elon Musk's rocket...'
item.description: Vivek said it's wrong that the two assassination attempts on Donald Trump became normalized in the country. "There's something peculiar in the country that Donald Trump was shot once, we blame Donald Trump. Donald Trump was shot twice, we blame Donald Trump. I am glad Elon Musk's rocket made it back and they caught it. If not, they would have on Sunday blamed Donald Trump for that too, I think."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trump had no sense of who he was talking to; he slammed Jews in front of pro-Israel backers'
item.description: At a gathering of wealthy donors, Donald Trump made controversial remarks about Kamala Harris, calling her 'retarded' and criticized affluent Jewish Americans for not supporting him. Maggie Haberman noted Trump's apparent lack of awareness of his audience and changes in his behavior over time, suggesting decreased filters as he aged.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ​Maggie Haberman says Donald Trump's 30-minute townhall dance was weird but...
item.description: CNN political analyst, a long-time Trump watcher, Maggie Haberman said Trump's 30-minute dance was weird but he does such weird things in private. It was probably the first time he did something like this in the public as he got anxious after two people fainted at the townhall which delayed the event and then he opted to play music instead of continuing with the townhall.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New bill on assisted dying introduced in UK parliament; key details
item.description: A new bill to legalise assisted dying in England and Wales has been introduced, drawing mixed reactions. The proposal requires judicial and medical approval and applies to terminally ill individuals with limited life expectancy. Strong opinions exist for and against the potential change in law.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Megyn Kelly's analysis on Harris going to Fox, Rogan: 'If you have good internal polling...'
item.description: Megyn Kelly said in a change of approach Kamala Harris now has put herself out there as the vice president would be giving her first official interview to the Fox News later today. Reports claimed her team is also in the talks with Joe Rogan's podcast where Donald Trump will also appear. Megyn Kelly said if one's internal polling is good, they don't take such risks at the last moment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: PIMCO says UK budget unlikely to shock markets, gilts look attractive
item.description: PIMCO executives remain optimistic about the UK's fiscal outlook, expecting tight budget measures from Finance Minister Rachel Reeves. Despite recent underperformance, they predict an improvement in gilt yields. The new Labour government aims to boost productivity through reduced red tape and infrastructure improvements.

item.title: Meghan Markle's missing engagement ring more significant than Kate's because...
item.description: Both Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton were seen without their engagement rings in recent appearances. Kate's missing ring signifies milestones with Prince William, while Meghan's absence of her ring fuels speculation about her marital issues with Prince Harry, as they pursue separate professional paths. Meghan's engagement rings underwent several changes since it was first given to her by Prince Harry in 2017.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Kamala Harris share fake news about Donald Trump's 'senior moment'?
item.description: However, ABC News has dismissed the Harris campaign's suggestion that Trump experienced a "senior moment" on stage, instead highlighting how well he managed the situation. The broadcaster reported that Trump had decided to change the course of the rally after two of his supporters encountered medical issues during the event in Oaks, Pennsylvania.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bodycam footage of 6-ft tall Sydney Wilson with knife has Internet divided: Here's what happened
item.description: Sydney Wilson, a mental health specialist, was fatally shot by Virginia cop Peter Liu after she attacked him with a knife during a welfare check. Bodycam footage shows Wilson stabbing Liu, prompting him to open fire. Wilson, a former Georgetown University basketball player, became a focal point for a debate about police use of force and racial bias.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
